KEY RESULT: 40% reduction in PR review time, 370% 3-year ROI, breakeven in 4-5
months with initial investment of $4-5K hardware + $2-3K annual operations.

================================================================================
KEY FINDINGS
================================================================================

BUSINESS IMPACT:
- PR review time: 40-60% reduction (45 min → 15-25 min)
- Issue response: 24+ hours → <1 hour
- Developer CI wait time: 40% reduction (eliminates 5-15 min queue)
- Manual effort: 40+ hours/week → ~20 hours/week
- Adoption target: 100% in 90 days
- ROI: 370% over 3 years (breakeven month 4-5)

INFRASTRUCTURE:
- Initial deployment: 3-4 runners on 1-2 servers
- Year 1 cost: $6,000 total ($4K hardware + $2K ops)
- Cost per workflow: $0.08-$0.10 (vs $0.18 with GitHub-hosted queue)
- Scales to: 15-20 runners by Year 3
- Annual cost Year 2-3: $8,000-$12,000

OPERATIONAL:
- 99.9% SLA target (8.7 hours downtime/year)
- <30 second job startup
- <2 minute queue wait (P95)
- >95% workflow success rate
- <20% idle capacity during normal operations

LABELING STRATEGY:
- 48 total labels across 6 categories
- System labels (8): All runners have these
- Resource tiers (6): Default tier-standard (4-6 vCPU, 8-12 GB)
- Team labels (5): Organizational isolation
- Workflow types (10): Functional categorization
- Priority levels (3): Queue management
- Status labels (3): Operational tracking

CONSTRAINTS IDENTIFIED:
- Technical: Windows-only, corporate proxy, native runners required
- Security: SOC2 Type 2, GDPR, PAT rotation 90-day cycle
- Budget: Limited initial investment, open-source preferred
- Timeline: 10 weeks to production (2+2+4+2 weeks)

RISKS IDENTIFIED:
- HIGH: Secret exposure (Medium prob, Critical impact)
- HIGH: API rate limiting (Medium prob, High impact)
- HIGH: Runner failure (Low prob, High impact)
- MEDIUM: WSL performance variance, slow adoption, LLM rate limits
- LOW: GitHub outage, network loss

   - SOC2 audit trail implementation
   - Automated PAT rotation setup

5. CAPACITY PLANNING
   - Proactive monitoring of auto-scaling triggers
   - Maintain <20% idle capacity
   - Plan for Year 2 growth (50% increase predicted)
